greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(0)=0; thereafter a(n) = a(n-1) + prime(n) if a(n-1) < prime(n), otherwise a(n) = a(n-1) - prime(n).
comment: a(n) < 2*prime(n). Conjecture: a(n) > 0 for n > 3. - _Thomas Ordowski_, Dec 03 2016 [This conjecture is false, because a(369019)=0. The next counterexample occurs at n = 22877145. - _Dmitry Kamenetsky_, Feb 14 2017. (Cf. A309225.)]
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
formula: a(n) = c(1)p(1) + ... + c(n)p(n), where c(i) = 1 if a(i-1) > p(i) and c(i) = -1 if a(i-1) <= p(i) (p(i) = primes). - _Clark Kimberling_
maple: A008348 := proc(n) option remember; if n = 0 then 0 elif A008348(n-1)>=ithprime(n) then A008348(n-1)-ithprime(n); else A008348(n-1)+ithprime(n); fi; end;
# Maple from _N. J. A. Sloane_, Aug 31 2019 (Start)
# Start with s, add or subtract a[n], get M terms. If a has w terms, can get M=w+1 terms.
if whattype(a) <> list then ERROR("First argument should be a list"); fi;
if a[1]=0 then ERROR("a[1] should not be zero"); fi;
for n from 1 to M2 do
if a[n]>t then t:=t+a[n] else t:=t-a[n]; fi; b:=[op(b),t]; od:
# Riecaman transform of primes, starting at s=0
mathematica: a := {0}; For[n = 2, n < 100, n++, If[a[[n - 1]] >= Prime[n - 1], b := a[[n - 1]] - Prime[n - 1], b := a[[n - 1]] + Prime[n - 1];]; a = Append[a, b]]; a (* _Stefan Steinerberger_, May 02 2006 *)
program: (PARI) lista(nn) = {print1(a=0, ", "); for (n=1, nn, if (a < (p=prime(n)), a += p, a -= p); print1(a, ", "););} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Dec 04 2016
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_ and _J. H. Conway_
